item.title: Prefix or Suffix oh-my-zsh's shell prompt
item.description: Almost every developer loves his/her cool and colorful shell, so I install oh-my-zsh on my laptops and remote servers. However, as I use similar themes of oh-my-zsh and I also have the exactly same user name, most time I could not distinguish the actual machine on which I was operating. I tried to search online about how to decorate the zsh prompt so that I can insert a machine label within it.

item.title: Run a shell script auto-matically when entering/cd a directory
item.description: I don’t know if it is common that you need to run some shell scripts which are used under only some directories, such as, one of your Rails projects. Today I find that I always need to run rspec command with a SPEC option, which specifies spec files to be run. In short, everytime I should type the following command in my terminal: rake spec SPEC=spec/lib/ It is convenient to run this command as an alias, but I don’t want to write this alias into the ~/.
